text.0: may they ascend the lowest highest midmost the fathers who deserve a share of soma.
text.1: may they who have attained the life of spirits gentle and righteous aid us when we call them.
text.2: now let us pay this homage to the fathers to those who passed of old and those who followed.
text.3: those who have rested in the earthly region and those who dwell among the mighty races.
text.4: have attained the graciousminded fathers i have gained son and progeny from viṣṇu.
text.5: they who enjoy pressed juices with oblation seated on sacred grass come oftenest hither.
text.6: fathers who sit on sacred grass come help us these offerings have we made for you accept them.
text.7: so come to us with most auspicious favour and give us health and strength without a trouble.
text.8: may they the fathers worthy of the soma invited to their favourite oblations.
text.9: laid on the sacred grass come nigh and listen may they be gracious unto us and bless us.
text.10: bowing your bended knees and seated southward accept this sacrifice of ours with favour.
text.11: punish us not for any sin o fathers which we through human frailty have committed.
text.12: lapped in the bosom of the purple mornings give riches to the man who brings oblations.
text.13: grant to your sons a portion of that treasure and present give them energy ye fathers.
text.14: our ancient fathers who deserve the soma who came most noble to our soma banquet.
text.15: with these let yama yearning with the yearning rejoicing eat our offerings at his pleasure.
text.16: come to us agni with the gracioug fathers who dwell in glowing light the very kavyas.
text.17: who thirsted mid the gods who hasten hither oblation winners theme of singers praises.
text.18: come agni come with countless ancient fathers dwellers in light primeval godadorers.
text.19: eaters and drinkers of oblations truthful who travel with the deities and indra.
text.20: fathers whom agnis flames have tasted come ye nigh ye kindly leaders take ye each your proper place.
text.21: eat sacrificial food presented on the grass grant riches with a multitude of hero sons.
text.22: thou agni jātavedas when entreated didst bear the offerings which thou madest fragrant.
text.23: and give them to the fathers who did cat them with svadha eat thou god the gifts we bring thee.
text.24: thou jātavedas knowest well the number of fathers who are here and who are absent.
text.25: of fathers whom we know and whom we know not accept the sacrifice wellprepared with portions.
text.26: they who consumed by fire or not cremated joy in their offering in the midst of heaven.
text.27: grant them o sovran lord the world of spirits and their own body as thy pleasure wills it.
